name: Ocean Blue & Sand

reviews.text: We went to Ocean Blue for our 3rd time in 5 years to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We went with our family of 5 with our daughter's boyfriend. Everyone had an amazing time again!! The food at all the restaurants were always fresh and always something for everyone and and always very excellent. The staff is so very friendly and helpful. The entertainment is so enjoyable especially Alejandro. He made every day so enjoyable with the activities by the pools and on the beach. There is always fun for every age. We played with people older, younger and made a lot of new friends. Alejandro Beltran is very organized and made our stay a wonderful experience. He is great with activities, entertainment at the shows and there to help us if we need it. For example, I had a terrible cough and he helped me to purchase the right medicine since I do not know Spanish. I highly recommend Ocean Blue. I can't wait to go back for our 4th time. The rooms are huge and always clean. The beach is perfect, clean and very large. We went for a walk for 2 hours each way! Beautiful!! The grounds are meticulous, always maintained. Not a single complaint!! An Awesome Vacation!! Thank you!! By the way the ages were 47, 46, 21, 20, 18 and 14.
reviews.title: Outstanding for Our 3rd Visit to Ocean Blue!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We haven't been back to Punta Cana in over 8 years. The Ocean Blue has come up on our lists many times, but we went somewhere else instead. The cost and the timing was right to go back this year. The selection of liquers were definately for the Priviledge group, even Jim Beam wasn't available to me. They had some good stuff, but it was really messed up.
reviews.title: Nice Place, but not a Golden 5 Apple in our opinion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3-weeks in the Ocean Blue and Sand hotel and had the most amazing break. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the food in all venues was fantastic and the people were amazing. All the staff were just so helpful and friendly but a particular favourite of ours was Raquel from the main lobby bar. Everytime we saw her, she gave us a hug and welcomed us like family - thank you Raquel for helping make our stay so special and warm! We will definitely be returning to this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone. A massive thank you to all the staff and management at the Ocean Blue and Sand for making our holiday so enjoyable and memorable - see you all soon! x
reviews.title: AMAZING PLACE AND PEOPLE

reviews.text: Jan 27-Feb 03 2013.First time to Punta Cana. LOVED this place! Have been to all-inclusives' in Mexico which were great but this one beats 'em all...hands down! Great place! Staff was great and very friendly. The guys in the entertainment staff were super fun, lots of energy, can't say enough about them. Rooms were clean and well maintained, always had hot water for bath or shower. We were in building 4, nice compromise close enough to the pools and beach, but not to far from the lobby and restaurants. Good easy layout to find your way around. Only caution would be when it rains be careful walking,the tile and walkways are very slippery until they dry.Ample beach, little crowded layout for cabanas but hey I'm down there for the beach and sunshine, everyone's happy and clouds can be your friends! Food was phenomenal! You have to eat at the steak house! Italian was a close second.Breakfast buffet was...breakfast, plenty of everything. Lunch always had good choices, loved the beach lunch specials. And dinner.Wow! We ate at the steakhouse twice!! Once at the Italian, once at the Mexican, couple of times at dinner buffet.Mike's coffee is great! Hope to go back to this place again.Hi to Reginaldo and the entire staff! see you soon! W
reviews.title: Hands down,Great place!

reviews.text: This is my first trip to Caribbean. Although I have no comparison with other resorts, OBS far exceeded my expectation in all counts. The hardware (beach, property, room, lobby, etc...) is terrific, the food is excellent (I consider myself a food snob so I know what I'm talking about and I'm very surprised to see other reviews complaining about food), and the staff/service is just fantastic!!
reviews.title: Well fed, well entertained and well pampered!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at the Ocean Blue for 5 days starting October 8. The grounds and general area were okay...no major complaints. But I've been to other resorts that were much more beautiful. There was a lot of greenery but not many flowers; but the flamingos were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Do not recommend

likes.disliked: — Food and Lack of Hot Water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the food to be very disappointing....especialy Breakfast!!! Most of the items on the breakfast bar weren't even identifiable. We tried to keep an open mind and try different things but they were barely edible at best. After seeing trucks of eggs in the blazing sun enroute to the hotel we were leary of eating eggs for breakfast....however that would have probably been the best option. Lunch was very so-so and was basically the exact same thing every day. The dinner at the Mexican restaurant was pretty good; Italian - not bad. The best meal we had was at El Bogedon, however we had to pay and additional $50 for our meal....at that point it was worth it. Coffee shop was very nice. The bars were okay and the bartenders at the pool bar (closest to ocean) were very fun....they took good care of us.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was okay...could have been a little cleaner. The water situation is HORRIBLE. There was no hot water at all and barely any water at all at times. Based on reviews I've read since I got back, this problem must be on-going and not a one time thing.
reviews.title: Excelllent in 2006 but definately gone doown hill in 2007

likes.disliked: — Hot water problems while we were there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were nice but could use a little maintenance attention. The beach however was beautiful and very clean.
reviews.title: Loved the Ocean Blue Resort
Buyer Beware - Ocean Blue
reviews.text: The sports bar is okay but nothing great. The Casino is very small and most of the people playing slots complained that they were hitting nothing. For $20, you got nothing back to even give you any play time. Our last night there the resort was a little more crowded and the machines appeared to be a little more generous.

reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here No Matter How Cheap!!!!
reviews.text: This is my first review I've ever written good or bad, but thought it worth the time to save others from staying here.
My husband and I have traveled to the Dominican befores as well as to many of the other Carribean Islands and have always had a positive experience till this.
reviews.title: Ocean Blue - From Illinois Would return again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel with no greesting or cold drink given to us. We checked in and were sent to a desk on the right to set up an appt. to meet a time share rep. for breakfast. They do not tell you this is what it is for, but I knew it from reading Trip Advisor. We politely declined, they were not happy and tried to persist.
reviews.title: A vacation is what you make of it

reviews.text: We bookd this hotel for our wedding. We were there with a group of 33 inlcuding 3 kids under the age of 6 and everyone loved the resort.
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel

reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

likes.liked: — I like the set up of the lobby bar and restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was great. There was a different theme at the buffet every night and the a la cartes were all very good. We did have to wait at the Italian one night for an hour, but the food was worth it. You do not have to reserve at the a la cartes which is a nice bonus and you can visit each one as many times as you like. If you get there between 6 and 630 you usually can get right in and don't have to wait.
reviews.title: Disliked Certain Things

reviews.text: Pool:
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.text: The pools were very nice and they are huge!!!! They also both have a graduated entrance which is great for children. The yellow pool has the activities and the blue pool is nice and quiet. The blue pools has nicer chairs that are padded and there are two bar tenders at the pool bar which make getting your drink a bit faster. The yellow pool is closer to the beach and gets a bit sandy because some guests do not rinse off before getting in after being at the beach. We never had any problems getting chairs or umbrellas no matter what time we made our way to the pool.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beaches

reviews.text: We (2 adults, one 17 year old daughter, one 14 year old son) traveled July 18th through July 25th. The resort itself looked beautiful when we pulled in via bus transfer from the airport. Upon check in we were greeted by a waitress that handed us this cute little electric blue drink. It was delicious (called an Ocean Blue). Nice start to the trip. Just a fore-warning, you will receive a bracelet to wear determining your age bracket (the drinking age in Punta Cana is 18). Even though your teenager will have a different color bracelet than you, they still can get served alcohol.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room wasn't ready yet but no problem, they give you a card for each member of the family to take to the beach to get a beach towel and go ahead and use the pool and beach. Make sure you either wear your suit under your clothes, or pack them in your carry-on luggage, you will want to jump in immediately because it is a hot walk to the beach.
reviews.title: Stay Away

likes.disliked: — Poor airconditioning and lack of quick service

reviews.text: The pools are beautiful, and so is the beach. The rooms are pretty nice, not the greatest, but not the worst. The whole resort in laid out like a small town where the resturaunts are in one area, the rooms are in another area, and the casino, bowling alley, etc. are in the front, so I feel that it was a very safe environment to have the kids venture out with friends and meet up with us later.
reviews.title: Can I say WITHDRAWL!!!!!!

likes.liked: — How ease it was to have a great time. Everything you need is at your fingertips!
likes.disliked: — Slow internet service. But very entertaining staff meanwhile.

reviews.text: Now, on to the less than expected areas. The food. I cannot say anything good about the food. The buffet had a lot of variety, however, nothing appetizing. We tried so many different things, and always ended up taking a bite or two and that's it. Everything is so bland, and the combinations (like macaroni and cheese with mushrooms) were weird to say the least. Do not go here expecting to find steaks and seafood on the buffet. Breakfast selection was awful. Even if you think you recognize some food, check before eating it, because it's probably not the same thing you are used to unless you are of Dominican or Puerto Rican descent. The only saving part about the buffet was they had french fries, pizza and these dinner rolls that had a little cream cheese in them. Our kids at that all the time. Oh yea, one more thing, before you take a big bite of something that looks like chocolate from the desert section, double check, it just may be prunes, not chocolate.
reviews.title: Great Holiday

likes.liked: — Great complex, coffee shop, pool bars

reviews.text: Most of the time, you will probably spend eating at one of the two buffets. The one on the beach is smaller and busier. The buffet on the beach turns into an a la carte resturaunt at night, which offers a menu to choose from. Still not typical food, but at least its not the buffet. The two resturaunts that are not included in your "all-
reviews.title: Great Holiday

likes.liked: — Great complex, coffee shop, pool bars

reviews.text: When we pulled up to the resort, we were overwhelmed at how beautiful everything was. From the decoration in the lobby to the pools, the beach and rooms, everything looks perfect on the surface. We were all checked in as VIPs at the Elite Club since this was booked through business, where you have concierge service and supposed 'special treatment' throughout the stay. It's only when you run into some issues that you start to realize that from top to bottom at this resort, nobody understands the importance of customer service or respect for the customers/clients.
reviews.title: Absolutely No Customer Service

reviews.text: -No hot water for the entire trip, we had to shower in our friends room since maintenence was completely unresponsive after 4 days of phone calls.
reviews.title: Ocean Blue

reviews.text: -When a pipe burst in the toilet early one morning, the front desk said to call back in an hour when someone else could help (only when we called back telling them their hotel rooms would flood did we get any type of action).
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Resort!!

reviews.text: -When spa appointments were running late, we didn't receive a call telling us - we were told upon arrival and were told to sit and wait.
reviews.title: Fantastico Value!!!!

reviews.text: -When our friends were locked out of their room, it took well over an hour for a new key/security to arrive. When we called to check the status, we were yelled at.

reviews.text: The resort itself is medium sized. No need to take the golf carts that roam like taxis to assist the elderly or heat addled. There are 5 restaurants included in the all inclusive and 2 more that can be booked for additional costs. There's also a sports bar and a disco as well as a casino (gambling is also not "all inclusive:)

reviews.text: Hi, We just got back from Ocean Blue and had a great time from Aug. 4 to Aug 13- We booked through Apple vacation, and their reps were there waiting for us at the airport and on site all day. We booked 3 excursions through apple (snorkeling, saona and ATV's rides) It might be a little more expensive, but it really pays to go through them, as they look into every detail and you have them on site to complain if anything goes wrong!
reviews.title: Love this hotel, very friendly staff

likes.liked: — The pool....the beach....the layout of the whole resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got there, we were assigned a room in villa 5. I asked if there was any chance to have a room with a pool view and we were re assigned to a room in villa 6, which is the Elite Villa at NO extra charge! The rooms in Villa 6 are much better than others, extra large rooms, all wood furniture, jacuzzi, marble floors and the mattress is extra thick and there are 4 pillows in each bed!!! Don't be affraid to ask....if there is any room available, they will give it to you.....specially if you put a $20 with your request!!
reviews.title: Ocean Blue was a wonderful Place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is really friendly, always happy! I don't think the language is a barrier, they try very hard to talk to everybody in english or french. They all work very hard trying to please us and they want to see us having a good time!!! But, be aware that there are lots of haitians working in this hotel, like the boys in charge of the beach towels, they are not dominican, and you can tell.... by the way they provide their services!
reviews.title: Can't fault it.

reviews.text: I read lots of complains, but don't pay attention....just go! with a positive attitude, remember YOU ARE THERE TO RELAX!! it is not a 5 start hotel, but it is very cozy and the service is good, food is good, there is lots of things to do...specially if you like sports...my kids (19-16) spent all day playing volley in the beach with the entertainment team...these kids are awesome! They are very energetic and they work really hard!

reviews.text: Well, let me 1st say that my husband and I stayed at the Ocean Sand/Ocean Blue for 3 weeks after investigating thoroughly many many resorts in Punta Cana for our wedding. We travelled with our 2 kids (16 yrs old and 8 yrs old), along with 9 others!....so this is going to be a long and very honest review! lol
reviews.title: Paradise Found

likes.disliked: — There was nothing that I did not like about the accomodations.

reviews.text: Stayed here during late November of 2005. I won't repeat what everyone else has written, but will comment on just a few things.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My family visited the ocean blue resort in punta cana from march 20 thru march27.We had a fabulous time. We booked our trip thru apple vacations.We flew out of chicago via United airlines and arrived in Punta cana a 3:00 pm in the afternoon .It was wonderful to feel the warm air exiting the airplane.After getting our luggage we looked for the apple reps and found them.We were put into a van with three other couples and we started our adventure.The countryside around punta cana is very rural and the people do not live very well. after dropping off the two couples at their resorts we arrived at ocean blue.The stAFF at ocean blue unpacked our stuff and grinned at all our luggage.We are a family of six,so you can imagine!My husband got us checked in,I got us two drinks and the kids changed into their suits and went off running.We were put in villa 5 ocean side on the third floor in two rooms facing the pool.The rooms were not connecting but right next to each other.There are no connecting rooms at the resort.This is since you can have 5 people to a room if you want.However.we had six and we wanted space.The rooms were great and the maid kept them well stocked with drinks,water beer and soda,except we asked that the kids rooms be without beer.We loved our view of the pool.Each day we would watch people walking from 6:00 until 7:30 in the morning putting down towels.It was funny seeing alot of peple in their pj's.On march21 we had our first full day at the resort.We ate at the breakfast buffet which was loaded with everything imaginable from pastries,donuts salmon,eggsfrench toast,fruit galore,cerals,bacon sausage,no one left hungry.Off to the pools and beach.the beach is beautiful with many shaded ares if you so desire.Their are two pools with the one closest to the beach as the one hundreds of families gathered to laugh and mingle.We always smiled to the staff with a hola and they smiled back.The staff work very very hard.If you smile and say hello and please and thankyou you will receive great service.The food was fine for our family at the buffet always enough choice for the picky eater wheather at breakfast at the main buffet or lunch at the beach.the ala cartes were ok,do not expect 5 star service or quality like you would at home.We preferred the buffet in the evening since it was ever changing for the whole family.The casino was small,not vegas even in a small sense.We did not attend the evening show,instead preferred to go to the lobby bar with live music until ten.After ten in the evening you ahd acouple of choices,stay in the lobby and mingle,or go to the disco which opened at 11:00p.m. or go to beach bar and relax with the ocean breeze and a drink.
reviews.title: ocean blue was great
Great Place to Vacation!
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time at ocean blue.Also we met somee really wonderful people from Paris,belgium,canada,maryland newyork,minnesoda,chicago,germany.Our kids mat so many friends that they were busy all day long.I will end this review as saying go to ocean blu resort with a smile and to relax and you will have a great time.

reviews.title: great time
reviews.text: I thought it was very nice there where only 3 things i would watch out for : People with a royal shirt they try to sell you stuff, the vendors they chase after you so you will buy there stuff and the costant music playing but other than that it was great the beach is lovely the pool is a perfect temperature and the swim up bar is great! I would definitely go back.

MY husband and I had a great time at the resort. We arrived at the hotel around 11pm and it was a bit confusing for us to try and figure out how to check in,but once we found the check in on the right side of the lobby it went smoothly. We requested a king bed, were told we had one and when we got to the room there were 2 queens(a little disappointing) and some of the tile was coming off in the bathroom. we decided not to try and change rooms because we did not want the hassle. we were able to get a burger at the sports bar-not to good, went to bed. Next day was great. we found the people very friendly and helpful. food was good. our meals at the Italian, American were really good. We got there at 5:45 to eat at 6:30 because of the lines.Other people we talked to did not have good meals at these restuarants. It is kind of hit or miss. Buffets were great, spa massagegreat, ok workout room,needs to open earlier than 8am very crowded early. Lobster at seafood place very good. Not the best place we havebeen to but we would go back and take the kids. Safari adv. very fun. nice getaway for us
reviews.title: Loved the Ocean Blue
Nice resort but.......

I booked through cheap carribean.com and was very satisfied.
reviews.title: I'm going back!

reviews.title: Great Wedding at Ocean Blue!

reviews.text: I have been to many places and Ocean blue was very nice.
reviews.title: Hola senor, Hola senora

likes.disliked: — The lighting situation in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to a different restaurant nightly on the resort. Get there early to avoid the rush. I could have done without the Domincan and Mexican rest (just ok). The lobster dinner (2 lbs) on the beach was good, not worth the $$. Route 55 was great! Italian was very good and Mikes coffee is the perfect stop every afternoon and nigt. Coffee is terrific! Take some home, but deal with the locals in the market. I enjoy a cup every day. Try the Mommajuana, the local aphrodesiac. You can take the prepared version home, but cannot take the bottle with just the dry ingredients. They WILL confiscate at the airport. The people are fun and offer this drink of rum, honey and other ingredients freely.
reviews.title: ***FINALLY - A NORMAL Persons Review!***
Stunning Resort/Wonderful People
reviews.text: If you can't find something you like, your not looking.

Our family of 4 stayed at the Ocean Blue from 8/6-8/11/07. My husband and I are 49 and our two kids are aged 24 and 22. We all had a great time at the Ocean Blue and would definitely return again. The staff could not be more friendlier. The food was ok for what is was but remember you are not home.......The American Restaurant Route 66 and Mike Coffee House were the best. If you are going to the Ocean Blue IT'S A MUST TO GO TO MIKE'S. The rooms were kept very clean and whenever we asked for water or towels they were supplied very quickly. The staff conducted activites each and every day for both adults and kids but mostly geared to kids. They also performed by the pool each and every day. The ocean was gorgeous. Our main focus was relaxation and that's exactly what we did relax. The kids loved Victor the bartender......they miss you! We met many great people there. We will return to the Dominican however, as much as we loved the Ocean Blue we would like to go somewhere else for comparison.
reviews.title: Loved the Ocean Blue

likes.liked: — Everything right there at the resort

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I went down for my cousins wedding. The wedding was great however the Ocean Blue experience was not great.

reviews.text: We stayed in the room overnight and requested a room change the next day, the staff was not very accomidating stating "what do you mean the room smells?" Obviously we weren't the first people to notice this as the AC intake duct had several of the coffee bags it in trying to help with the smell.

The next room was in better shape. The beds were hard and lower in the middle then on the ends from so much wear. Also every morning about 9am regardless of the do not disturb sign the maid would come into the room using her pass key.

likes.disliked: — Hard to get clean towels sometimes and only once did we get washrags!!!! Very slow moving staff, but afterall, you are in the Dominican and on vacation. Took some getting used to.

Seven restaurants to chose from, two of which did carry an extra supplement. Too be honest we didn't use these because we were completely satisfied and spoilt for choice with the others.

reviews.text: All in all a holiday that we will never forget.
reviews.title: great place but not much to do

reviews.text: OK! so one bad thing - Timeshare - If anyone reading this, decides to book remember the following - If reception send you to a side desk and you are invited to a VIP breakfast, don't go. It is to try and get you to cut out the middle man and buy holiday time at their hotels. If you miss this, you could get caught by a salesman when going into the buffet restaurant where you will be offered a free massage!! It is another way of trying to get you to give your time (at least 3 hours) to listen to one of their salesmen. It is called H10 Premium and the hotel are part of it and well aware what is going on!! We cottoned on very quickly so politely said 'No thank you' and we also warned others.
reviews.title: super fantastic

reviews.text: Trip from 12/28/07 thru 1/4/08 via Apple vacations.
reviews.title: Had a 3.5 star time (out of 5)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is rated as a 5 star resort. I would call our stay a 3.5 star vacation.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, but Lacks Friendliness

reviews.text: We were in the 'Elite' club which comes with extra perks.
reviews.title: Had a Blast @ Ocean Sands!!!
OK food, good drinks, great beach
reviews.text: Before leaving I read all the reviews here and , like many I'm sure, was quite apprehensive about the hotel. I wasn't involved in making the plans, but this was a last second type decision so our choices were limited.

reviews.title: Liked some parts, disliked others
reviews.text: No problems getting to the hotel from the airport. The Apple bus stopped at 4 hotels, with ours being the last stop. I think it took a total of about 40 minutes. All the other hotels are next to each other so it didn't eat up that much time being the last stop.

reviews.title: No complaints !!!
reviews.text: My husband and I have no complaints about this resort. This was our first

trip to an all inclusive resort.We have nothing really to compare it to, but all we can say is it was absolutely beautiful.Reading all the reviews we were a bit nervous about going there.No compaints about the food. We stuck to the buffett. Great selection!! we had no problems with the service.I guess where ever you go , you will find people who didn't have everything run so smoothly or will find something to complain about. I loved the fact we had access to internet ( $4 for 15 mins. ) we could keep in touch with family back home. Shopping on the beach and in town may drive you crazy but you learn to deal with that.You ask them the price of something and its always $40.00. By the time you leave there you only pay $10.00.Never pay the price they are asking. They try and get as much as they can from the tourists.They are very aggressive and some of them get very upset if you don't buy anything.If you want to try an excursion, I would highy recommend the Outback Tour. Really interesting and an eye opener to see the poverty and the way they live .We took lots of candy for the kids along the route. Some people had gifts and school supplies.The kids really appreciate it.We stopped by the school along the route. Had a great time and wouldn't hestitat about going back to this resort but will try a different resort next year.
reviews.title: Good but not great!

reviews.text: My family and I just came back from the ocean sand/blue golf on June 12th. First I must say that this review will be long, so be prepared to read a lot.
reviews.title: More than we expected!
You'll love it......
reviews.text: I booked our vacation in May 2005. We decided to go to this hotel because it was a 5 stars and it was also the first time that my husband and children were going to the Caribeen, so we wanted something ''safe''. I was craving for reviews and informations on this hotel. Even though the resort received some really bads reviews, we decided to go and make our own idea.

reviews.title: Mediocre at best
reviews.text: CHECK-IN: Was really easy. We arrived at 10:00 p.m. Our packaged included a cold towel on arrival and a welcome cocktail, we received none of that. But the check-in itself went really quick and easy.

reviews.title: great hotel, looks like a small city
reviews.text: The hotel is very nice and was build like a small city. Restaurants are nice and the food is very good. Entertainment was good but not during the rainy days :(

My husband and 11 year old son just returned from Ocean Sand. This resort is beautiful...the grounds, the beach, the pools. The food is excellent, there is so much selection that you can always find plenty to eat. The restaurants are good, we especially enjoyed Route 66 (more American style restaurant) The staff are fabulous. They all work very hard to make your vacation a memorable and satisfying one. We probably had the most relaxing vacation yet. The weather was incredible. One note: you need to get up by 6:00 and 7:00 to "reserve" a cabana on the beach or an umbrella at the pool if you want to have any shade during the day. Just leave your towels, books etc there and then go back to bed! I am an early riser so this did not bother me, but it is really worth it to get some shade especially in the afternoon. Don't worry about negative reviews.....this place is absolutely incredible.
reviews.title: Absolutely Incredible

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ocean Blue Resort from March 11-15. Our trip cost $699 per person which included RT non-stop airfare from Newark, NJ. We booked our trip through Apple Vacations. Apple Vacations is always good and they also provided transportation to and from the airport to our hotel. Here is my honest review:
reviews.title: Average but nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESORT: The hotel was average but the weather and beaches definitely made up for that. It was a very large resort and long walk from our room to the restaurants or main lobby. No complaints about that though because we didn't mind walking and exercise is good! There are golf cart trolleys running regularly that take guests back and forth. I thought the overall resort theme was a little tacky with the bowling alley, sports bar and Route 66 Restaurant. We upgraded to the Privilege Club which got us an upgraded room - we were the first room in the first building right next to the beach - so that was good. We had access to the Privilege Club beach and had our own beach towels. Our room had a jacuzzi and stand up shower. The shower was very small and tight - I would have rather had the bathtub shower that was in our first room. But this room was big and decent and had a little porch area as well. Also included with the Privilege Club was liquor - they provided us with a bottle of Absolut, Johnny Walker Red, Barcelo rum, vermouth and gin to our room. Room service was included as well and we only used that once. We received a complimentary fruit basket.
reviews.title: Amazing Wedding and Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: I am usually tolerant of so-so food and I don't consider myself to be a food connoisseur or critic; but the food here was awful. After sharing stories with other friends who visited the D.R. and other hotels, I realized it wasn't limited to my hotel. Everyone had the same opinion about the food at their hotels, too. The food leaves A LOT to be desired. Our first night, we ate at the Margarita Restaurant. I had a chicken fajita and it was not good. The chicken was ground up and the sauces were really funky. The salsa, I think, was the same sauce they use for pasta at the buffet, the guacamole was weird and the cheese sauce was just gross. It was a COLD yellow blob. SO, skip this restaurant. We had breakfast at the Carribean Grill and again, it was disappointing. Even the little croissant tasted stale and weird. Our "potatoes" were round hashbrown cakes and my boyfriend's sausage was a hotdog. The same restaurant had a buffet lunch - the meats and cheeses look a little slimy (I only eat chicken and turkey) so I avoided those. Pizza tasted funny. So, I played it safe and ate penne with tomato sauce and some dried-up BBQ chopped up chicken parts. If it weren't for the swim up bar and huge amounts of alcohol I was consuming, I'd actually lose weight on this vacation. I was actually afraid for dinner. Too many drinks at the swim up bar did us in on Friday so we skipped dinner. Our Privilege Club upgrade included a lobster dinner. So, on Saturday, we had a lobster dinner down on the beach and TG it was good!!! We had (3) grilled 1/2 lobsters and they were delicious! So, if you want to pay extra, the lobster dinner is worth it. On Sunday night, we decided to try one of the nicer restaurants and we were NOT allowed in - my boyfriend was not wearing SLACKS. He had a nice pair of plaid shorts but we were not allowed in. So, we never had a chance to try one of the nicer restaurants. So, we went back to Caribbean Grill and had more lobster. SO, remember, if you are a guy, to bring a pair of slacks. One more thing, PACK GRANOLA BARS, PROTEIN BARS or INSTANT OATMEAL. Just because the food is not good.
reviews.title: best vacation ever
poor service- nice infrastructures
reviews.text: We went there as a yong couple, there seems to be missing a age group; people from 25 to 30, lot's of famillies but they coexist nice with the adult only tourist. Beautiful infrastructures, nice rooms, nice restaurants, pool, nice beach, the drinks are good, name brands (scoth red label) champagne all day long even breakfast, food is average, buffet has lots of selection but it's the same everyday, dont pay the big bucks to go there, we got a good deal but some people paid much more than us.

reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Relax!!!
reviews.text: They apply pesticide at night, whithout care of who is walking around. We had bugs in our room, got bit three nights all over, the majority don't speak english so forget trying to get a new room. Don't tip too much, it won't make a difference, service will still be poor. Bar service is very slow (10-12 min wait for a drink with only 10-12 people around the bar), room service;forget that. Sewer smell at night near lobby (strong odor). Golf service is so-so, they'll drop you off but won't pick you up. Golf is nice but new, caddies don't speak english at all. This place needs to shape up with their service and it will be a number one resort

reviews.title: Great Relaxing Vacation, Ready to go back again
reviews.text: Don't pay the big bucks for this resort, at least not right now

reviews.title: Great vacation at Ocean Blue
reviews.text: My best friend and I were at the Ocean Blue from 4/8-4/13. We had the most wonderful time and did exactly what we had planned to do there....RELAX! The rooms were clean and spacious, the bathroom was beautiful with a huge jacuzzi tub. The only complaint there was that there was only one glass door to the tub, so if you didn't position the shower head just right, the whole bathroom was soaked. We ate mostly at the buffet for all three meals, but we did try the Mexican restaurant as well as LaBrasa (the Dominican). We weren't too crazy about the Mexican restautant, it just wasn't the food we were used to here. LaBrasa, however, was phenomenal! The presentation of the food was like artwork, almost too pretty to eat. Eduardo, the bartender at the first pool bar, was awesome!!!!! He was the nicest guy and made great drinks. He works 12 days on and has 3 days off, so chances are you'll see him the whole time you are there. We made sure to stop by on our last day just to say good-bye. The language barrier was a little difficult at times, but everyone (including us) tried very hard to communicate and the staff was so friendly and helpful. We were surprised at how low key and not crowded this resort was. There was never a problem finding a chair by the pool, but if you wanted an umbrella I suggest getting there early. The beach vendors were amusing and a little pushy, but willing to bargain for anything! One vendor gave us jewelry for a Lance Armstrong "Live Free" bracelet. This was definitely a vacation worth every penny we spent and somewhere I will go back to in the future (I'm hoping to go back in October with my husband!)

reviews.title: Run!!!
reviews.text: I just returned home from the ocean blue resort. (April 12 - 16)

Stayed at the Ocean Blue in May 2007, overall the hotel experience was positive. The food was what you would expect for an all-inclusive resort with numerous options. A few in our group experienced stomach issues, but not so much that it ruined the trip.
reviews.title: Beware of weekend visitors....
Loved Ocean Blue
reviews.text: Our main negative experience (And this was a major negative) was that on the weekend we were there, an influx of non-family oriented visitors came to the hotel. While our group definitely liked to have a good time, we were embarassed to see the display of drunkeness and disregard for others that was exhibited by this group.

It went so far as that 2 of them engaged in sex in one of the public pools in the middle of the day - Guests stood around in shock/horror as this continued for approximately 15 minutes. Thankfully there were not many children around, and those that were did not understand what was happening.
reviews.title: Irish point of view - Fantastic!
beautiful beaches -bad sevice
reviews.text: All-in-all, I would be very cautious about bringing my family/children to this resort - especially around the weekends when these groups seem to frequent the resort.

My family and I had a great time at Ocean Blue Beach and Golf Report. The staff was great and the hotel was always clean. The best bar there is the Overtime bar with Jose as the bartender. He was very attentive to all of his patrons and accomodated everyone to their liking. Some of the other bartenders were not as welcoming and nice. We will absolutely go back and stay there again.
reviews.title: 1st all-inclusive trip

reviews.text: We also tried the italian, american diner and the caribean grill. These were all fantastic and had good menus to suit all tastes. How people can say the service is bad we cannot understand...all the staff wre so friendly and helpful! Always saying HOLA, smiling and dancing! The waiters and bar staff could not do enough for you...we never had an empty glass and never had to wait long for anything even during busy times!
reviews.title: Good and Bad
Beware
reviews.text: I can't tell you what the resort itself is like, because we were switched to another hotel the night before we were due to arrive. My husband and I made plans to travel with another couple to Ocean Blue. We were notified Friday night by CheapCaribbean.com that the hotel had overbooked and we were being moved. Fortunately we were moved to the same hotel as our friends, along with approximately 100 other guests. Our Cheapcaribbean rep told us that for the trouble, Ocean Blue would comp us a free weeks stay to be used any time in the next two years and would be giving us a package upon our arrival at the airport. Upon arrival, an Ocean Blue rep told us that we were moved to another resort because of some problems they had had with their computer system - all of the reservations did not go through, therefore they were overbooked. He then told us that we would have a package in the mail the next day explaining what happened and offering us a free week's stay to be used any time in the next ONE year's time. Then he very quickly shooed us off with a wave of his hand, ordering someone to take us to the different resort. We had spent months reviewing and researching resorts and had chosen Ocean Blue only to be sent to a place we had never heard of - now it's been over a week since that conversation and we have yet to receive anything in the mail. Nor has anyone answered any emails we have sent....although their site says they will get back to you in 24 hours...

reviews.title: Fabuleous Resort - Highly Recommended
reviews.text: Just got back from Ocean Sands/Blue Resort, stayed there the week of March 24th to the 31st. Had a little hicup with our entrance visa's due to skyservice not giving out the proper entrance cards, however this was soon forgotten when we arived at the resort....We had sent a request for building 9 or 10 as they are closest to the beach and they fullfilled our request. Our room was clean, new, nice and cool with the air conditioning, and the hot tub was relaxing....In the room you would of thought you were in a hotel back home....The pools were stunning, have a choice of the quieter pool or the pool with more activities....Water aerobics anyone? Stretchy Stretchy as the guys called it!!! LOL The food was excellent, even a not so good dinner at the italien restaurant could change our views on the food....The buffet breakfast is amazing...lunch by the beach is fabuleous (pizza is great)....and the late night buffet at the sports bar how can you go wrong....The weather was offering a little trouble with rain in the mid afternoon but if you were at the pool early you surely got your fill of sun...Highly recommend this resort for familys, older couples, couples looking for a quiet relaxing vacation....Looking for the party resort I wouldn't say Ocean Sands is your place....Will definatley go back...already looking forward to next year....

reviews.title: Best Dominican Vacation Yet!
reviews.text: From March 31st to April 7th, 2007, my wife and 16 year old daughter and I, along with eight other extended family members (including four other teens and 23 year old niece) enjoyed what we can only describe as a FABULOUS vacation at Ocean Blue Golf and Beach Resort.

We travelled on an AirTransat vacation package which flew directly from Hamilton, Ontario to Punta Cana, which was extremely convenient for us. WestJet operated the flight - in my opinion WestJet is one of the most friendly and efficient airlines. I travel extensively for business, and fly two or three time a month on WestJet to Western Canada, so I was happy that they were operating our vacation flight.
reviews.title: We were married at the Ocean Sands, Loved It!

likes.liked: — The room! We stayed in the Honeymoon Suite. It was BEAUTIFUL!!!
likes.disliked: — Nothing, but friends of mine on the first floor said it was a little musty

reviews.text: I found Punta Cana airport to be very efficient and quick to move through, and the Air Transat people where extremely organized and we where on our way to the resort within 30 minutes of landing. The bus ride to Ocean Blue was an experience on its own, but we need to remember that we are not in North America, and that the road and transportation standards are not what we are accustomed to. That said, this bus ride, along with the nearly daily trips I took to various golf courses on the island became a source of humour and actually added to the whole vacation experience!
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at Ocean Blue
wonderful time

reviews.title: I wanted to stay and live here forever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: A good time

likes.liked: — Check the prices in the gift shop before hitting the vendors on the beach - for some things even with haggling, we could have bought the items cheaper in the gift shop. :(

reviews.text: My family just got back from the Ocean Blue in Punta Cana and it was the best, most memorable time we ever had. This was our first time to Punta Cana and my 3 kids (ages 9, 13, 15) first trip out of the country. We all had an extremely wonderful time. The food is awesome, so much to choose from. The buffet has a different theme each night and there is always something for everyone..even my daughter who has to be the pickiest eater. The people are so friendly and helpful. Even though we do not know much spanish, we had no problem communicating with the staff. Ramone, the bartender at the yellow pool is the greatest man. He got to know our likes and saw to it that we always had a drink, even the kids and their soda or fruit slush. We would tip him for his wonderful services. Even though you don't have to tip, the staff make such minimal wages, we saw to it that they knew they were appreciated for their talents and did there jobs above and beyond! The activities are wonderful..from the water aerobics to learning how to dance to games. There is something for every age group. The nightly entertainment has a different show ranging from CHICAO to local talent. The lobby saxophone player sounded better than Kenny G! The cleaning lady always brought what we requested from her. We left a note with some candy and a dollar and everything was great. We went with Apple Vacations and they always have a rep for you to talk to regarding trips or anything else you might need. They were located in our Villa, which was just Apple Vacation people. We were located right outside the 2 pools. Speaking of the pools..they were HUGE!!! You could have your own space or have fun with the activities. The water was so clean and refreshing. The whole grounds of the Ocean Blue were the cleanest I have seen!! They were always picking up litter and making sure the grass and flowere were beautiful!! There was always a seat to be had at the pools. There must be hundreds and tons of umbrellas to sit under. The casino was small, but we still had fun at the black jack tables. The beach was huge!! Beautiful white sand and a wonderful ocean with plenty of seating. We were located right next to a small market place to buy anything from Rum to jewelry to knick knacks, etc. I can't say enough about this remarkable place. I am going to start saving so that we can come back. I would rate this out of 1 to 10, a 20!! We had no complaints!!
reviews.title: Ocean Blue Gold & Beach Resort Was Truly Awesome!

likes.liked: — The huge pools, the quality and different types of food, the staff and activities. Everything was fabulous!
likes.disliked: — That we had to go home. There was nothing to compain about at all. A wonderful accomodation!

reviews.text: My friend who lives in Michigan found this trip for us. It was a great bargain that was too good to pass up (seven nights for $890 per person…including roundtrip airfare and taxes!) I hadn't really considered visiting the Dominican Republic but needed a vacation and again, the price was right. I recruited three more friends and we booked the trip (3 rooms). After booking the trip, I read the reviews. At first I panicked and then decided that people who write reviews either really like the hotel or really hate the hotel. I decided I would make the best of the vacation and form my own opinion... which is what I recommend you do. Overall, I really enjoyed this vacation/hotel. We went there for rest and relaxation and would recommend this hotel to folks seeking the same. Here is what I found:

reviews.text: Just got back from Ocean Blue. Stayed 3/14-21 and booked through Apple. We are a family with five kids, ages 4 , 11, 16, 18, 21 and three additional friends ages 21. Everyone had a great time. We have stayed at Iberostars our last 6 trips, but decided to save some money and try another resort. So glad we did. The resort was beautiful. We had four rooms. Three were in villa 6 and 1 was in villa 5 next door (couldn't put us altogether but not a big deal). The pools were lovely and had a couple spots with shade from palm tree which we dragged one or two lounge chairs under every day (on the grass). Also lots of big umbrellas around the pool and if you look in the closet of your room, there is a blue umbrella you can take outside and stick behind your chair if need be. The ocean and beach were gorgeous and we managed to get a cabana with shade when we put towels on lounge chairs by 7 a.m. People go out as early as 5 a.m. and "reserve" chairs by putting towels and belongings down to "claim" it. We never hogged more than 2 chairs (a cabana holds four chairs) because I think it's rude if you're on the go most of the day to tie up chairs someone else can be enjoying. Not every family member needs a lounge chair because you're playing in the water, at the bar, getting food, etc. so in reality a chair isn't used that much. It was never a problem to find a chair in the sun, but by 7:15 a.m. the cabanas were taken. I also didn't think it was a big deal to share the cabana with two other people. In fact, we met some really nice people from Belgium that way and became friends. We were both looking for a cabana and each took two chairs and it was all we needed, even with our big family. Sometimes people "reserved" the cabana and then stayed at the pool all day so if you notice one not being used enjoy it until they get there. "Reserving" really isn't enforceable. When we decided to go to the pool we pulled all our stuff at the beach to free up the chairs for someone else. The food was delicious, the room was clean, the people were nice and the weather was perfect, although hot. Bring one bottle of suntan lotion per person. My younger kids wore water shirts and sunhats and even with 30+ lotion they burned a little. Sunglasses are of course a MUST for all ages. It's a long day in the sun. Even with suntan lotion it is easy to burn. My kids ages 16-21 went to the disco every night, and liked the sports bar and coffee shop. The 21 year olds naturally liked the swim up bar. Lots of music and dancing in the water. None of us went to the nightly shows, casino or specialty restaurants--we were content with the buffet and had our share of shows at Iberostars. I brought a lot of single dollar bills and tipped $3.00 per day per room, as they only make $200.00 per month on average. We bowled one game at bowling alley (coupon for free game is on the map they give you so save it but if you lose it they'll still let you bowl and be sure to bring socks--can't bowl without them). My 11 year old liked the bungi jumping ($10.00) and rock climbing wall (free) at the beach. We ate lunch by the beach every day which was really close to pool and beach, but had breakfast and dinner in the buffet restaurant. It was a longish walk but we didn't mind. We thought the food was good. We all found something we liked. We tried not to take more than we would eat so we didn't waste anything. You can always go back! Sad to see what some people take and then throw out just because they can. The ride from airport was about 35 minutes. But when leaving resort to go home be prepared to leave 4 hours before your scheduled flight as that is how they structure your departure time from resort. We had a great time--can't imagine you won't too. Also, rarely saw a mosquito at the resort if at all, but did get a couple bites at the airport in the middle of the afternoon, as part of it is open air and you walk out to the plane. Again, enjoy and remember the world is a mirror.
reviews.title: Ocean Blue was as much fun as our Iberostar vacations--we were very happy there.

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the beach. It is really spectacular. Regarding the hotel I do have several complaints. First – roaches in the room (that's why I gave room cleanliness only 1). Second complaint is staff. Some waiters, especially in Mexican and Dominican restaurants, are very unfriendly and openly annoyed by your presence. Out of all the restaurants, main buffet was probably the best, including attentiveness of the staff. Mike’s is a cute coffee shop and people working there are friendly and nice. Overall, it’s just an ok resort that needs some improvements. The beach is truly fantastic! I would go back to Punta Cana, but probably not to this resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I just returned from 5 days/4 nights at the Ocean Blue & the best I can say is that the resort is just "ok". We booked it based on the comments that we read here on Trip Advisor, as well as the recommendation of the Apple Tour representative we spoke with when considering various resorts in Punta Cana - unfortunately we were very disappointed with our choice. Since we were traveling in mid-March, which is the height of Spring Break season, we were looking for a quiet resort . Unfortunately, this was NOT it - it was LOADED with Spring Breakers who were looking to party 24/7 (been there, done that a loooooooong time ago!). We had to call Security 3 of our 4 nights there to break up late night (3am) parties & screaming/door slamming that was happening outside of our room (our last night there, we had to call them 3 times & we only ended up getting 2 hours of sleep). We felt like we had been deceived because we specifically asked about Spring Breakers when booking & were told "no, this is not the type of resort that would appeal to them". Hmmmmmmm Beyond the Spring Breakers issues, here are some overally thoughts about the resort.....If you have never vacationed at an all inclusive resort before, this is probably an ok introduction to one. However, if you've been to any of the more exclusive all inclusives (Palace Resorts, Sandals, etc), you'll be disappointed here - the service is not the same, the staff are not as attentive to your needs &/or resolving problems, the food is not as good, (including the fact that nothing was ever really cold enough - the blended drinks weren't frosty, yogurt was warm & soupy, the milk for cereal was warm, as were the shots of alcohol served at the bars), the rooms are not as well appointed (BTW - our room had roaches!), there aren't as many conveniences offered (only 1 place to get/return beach towels & it's located out of the way on the beach), and not "everything" is included in your all-inclusive (e.g., certain restaurants are not included & you have to pay extra if you want to eat there, no complementary excursions, etc), and the only place you could get free WiFi was in the Lobby Bar - otherwise you had to pay for internet access. On the positive side was that the beach and the pool were gorgeous. Overall, while we would go back to Punta Cana, we would not return to this resort.
reviews.title: Resort is just "ok"
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Ocean Blue was a great hotel - the best part is Mike's Coffee - it's like having your own Starbucks on site. The crowd seemed to be a bit older but we also weren't there during high vacation season.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at ocean blue went out of their way to make everyting just right. The property is clean and well maintained. The food in the main buffet was great, we always found something that we liked to eat there. We ate almost all of our meals in the main buffet. The Mexican restaurant was not good, and we would recommend not eating there. The bar staff was friendly and fun. We made friends with the main lobby bar tenders and were entertained nightly by Alex and his singing. The rooms were as advertised and nothing more. They were very clean, the furnishings were older and well used, but we spent most of our time at the wonderful white sand beach or on excursions. If your are going to spend most of your time in your room I would suggest something different. (why did you come to the beach to stay in your room?) We didn't use the pools, but from what we saw they were clean, and people that we talked to that used the pool and swim up bars were very happy there. There were children almost every place we went on the property, but for the most part they were well behaved and having a great time like we were. If having a great time on the beach, enjoying a swimming pool, and being treated like a good friend by the staff is what you are looking for then I suggest you check out Ocean Blue. Did I mention that there are 9 resturants and 10 bars, a bowling alley, a small casino, 2 swimming pools (one quiet pool, and a noisy pool full of music and water play (volley ball, water arobics.....) We are going to go back again next year, we talked to other people that were staying at other hotels in the area on our excursions and from what we were told we got the best service, best price, and best beach in the area. We did not play golf while we were there. We do play golf but we came for the water. the course however did seem to be a little less than wonderful. There are several very well maintained golf couses near by that you may want to check into for golf outings.

reviews.title: Hotel was beautiful - staff were great-happy vacation for NJ natives
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ocean Blue Resort from April 6-11. We stayed in Villa 3. Our Concierge "The Duke" was great - very helpful in booking our dinner reservations, tips on where to buy cigars etc. We arrived at the hotel, were able to immediately check-in, were greeted with a cool towel and welcome drink. In no time, we were wisked (via golf cart) to our villa and we were on the beach! The hotel is beautiful, it reminds me of a carribean village. We never found the staff to be slow in response. We ate at three of the restaurants, but found the food at the buffets to be just as good if not better. At each meal, our drinks were constantly refilled, finished plates removed from the table etc. The service was excellent. The staff work long hours, you will see the same servers at breakfast and then again later at night for dinner. Feel free to tip if you are happy with your service. They appreciate it, but never seemed to expect it. Ponche-Ponche at the cigar store was also a pleasure -- Very knowledgable - Tell him that Butch from NY said hello.

reviews.title: Absolutely loved the resort!!!
reviews.text: The grounds were kept very clean - take a walk through the courtyards that run down the middle of each villa - they are beautiful and also provide some shield from the sun as you walk to the beach.

reviews.title: Loved the entertainment crew!!
reviews.text: The beach was beautiful - soft sand and no rocks or shell to avoid in the water. You can walk for miles in either direction and it is totally safe. You can check out the other resorts as you go. The sun is extremely strong, so bring plenty of sun screen. One of the first things you notice when you first arrive is how tan or sunburned people are -- take that as a warning. I normally use at 15 sunblock and had to go to a 30 by the third day.

reviews.title: Disappointed in Ocean Blue
reviews.text: The pools were large and it was always easy to get a drink at the pool bar. All in all, this was a wonderful trip and a GREAT deal. It is one of the few resorts that I would return to.

For the price we paid for our vacation, we couldn't ask for more. We would definitely go back. :-)

reviews.text: We went to the Ocean Blue for our honeymoon. Personally, I found this to be a real good time with only a couple of small setbacks.

First, the good/great things about the resort. We booked through Apple vacations but they ended up putting us in Villa 6(along with Villa 7) is the best to stay. We tipped our maid a nice big portion the first day and she kept our room stocked with towels and drinks everyday. It did take a while to have our room cleaned each day but it was worth it. The food was good there but it was a touch on the bland side. I am not much into salting my food, but I had to salt everything while I was there. The Italian and the beach restaurants were amazing with there service and the food. We ate there and the buffet exclusively. I will tell you why belowThe bars, like the maid service, I tipped big the first day and I had there attention the whole time. Also, the Sports Bar was fantastic! The beach was nice and that is where we stayed almost the whole time, beautiful weather. Shopping was touchy, I had a small problem of one of the vendors grabbing my wife's arm as we were walking along, but the best thing is to do is get about 3,000 pesos and stick to your guns on bartering. Offer about 2/3rds less than what they want and if they negotiating just tell them that you are leaving. They will accept...TRUST ME!!!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better
Beautiful hotel poor service
reviews.text: The bad or poor, Route 66 was horrific. We went there the first time and we tried to get a menu, but kept telling us to hold on...we were one of the first people in the place, so we left. We tried it one other time, but they got my wife's order right, but failed twice that night, again we left. The Mexican restaurant was about the same. I had to walk to the lobby bar to get drinks and bring them back. When we did get served our food, it was cold. DO NOT go the Casino unless you want to hand them your money, the blackjack dealer was a tad shady and had to catch her once when we won. The last was the bowling...we were the only ones in there and one of the workers decided that he was going to play...RIGHT BESIDE US!!!! Annoying!!!
Overall, my wife and I enjoyed ourselves tremendously and it was a great honeymoon, but we probably would not go bact to the Dominican, unless the price was right.

reviews.text: There are no shady spots at all... the 2 pools are surrounded by beach umbrellas that do not tilt... so the only time they were of any use was when the sun was directly over your head.... I love the sun... but when it's beating down on you, the possibility of sitting in some shade usually is an option. It is not an option there. There are few palm trees, but they offer no shade either. The shelters they have at the beach are definitely NOT pleasing to the eye, nor offer any protection from the sun or rain. They are not huts made out of palm trees. They are square shelters w/strips of material stapled to the top. Very unattractive and crowded together. There were very few palm trees on the beach that offered any type of shade. The few that did were taken first thing in the morning. May have been 5-6 total shelters that were close enough to the trees to offer some shade. If you've ever been in one of the huts that a lot of beaches have, you know that you get shade as well as protection from the rain. These shelters offer neither. So any time it would rain you'd have to gather everything up and head for shelter. At the other resorts with the huts, we were able to stay put and wait the rain out. Not there! They closed part of the beach down while we were there to fix the broken shelters. They were still working on that when we left.

reviews.text: OK folks, take it or leave it but I will completely honest with this review. Let me first start by saying my wife and I have been to Punta Cana 4 times, this was our first to the Ocean Blue. We just got back yesterday, July 5th. First and foremost, if you just booked a trip to the Ocean Blue/Sand and you're reading negative reviews...stop it. I've been to excellent hotels in Punta Cana and this place is the best so far (sorry negative reviewers...perhaps you just shouldn't travel to an underdeveloped Spanish-speaking country just because you nabbed a bargain next time).
reviews.title: A Review from Very Seasoned Punta Cana Travelers

reviews.text: I only have a few negative comments, so let me get those out of the way - and they might not even be perceived as negative to you. First, the Ocean Blue has a very small beach - probably one of the smallest in Punta Cana but I will note that I heard American tourist after American tourist walk on to the beach and comment, "what an amazing beach! Honey, take a picture!" So, it must have been their first time. We personally love the very long, expansive beach resorts in Punta Cana. The food at O.B. makes up for it though. Second negative is that while a big plus is that the a la carte restaurants do not require reservations (first in Punta Cana not to require 24 in advance reservations including menu selection) they accept large parties with a smile. These dining rooms are small, perhaps 70 - 80 seats, so when they do this, we found that we were told that we would have to wait at least an hour for a table for two. We never managed to get into the Mexican restaurants. From a restaurant owning family myself, I would suggest to the O.B. that they implement a cut-off policy at tables of 8, after that you have to split up into separate tables. It's better to have one upest family rather than 10. Finally, the Royal Holiday time share people can be a pest. Good thing is that they are only they during breakfast. When you see these people in white polo shirts handing out the hotel's daily activities sheets, walk on by and say "NO THANK YOU" and they will leave you alone. If you want a daily activities sheet, pick up one at reception, or stop by Villa 5 where Apple Vacations has a desk and keeps a stack there you for you.
reviews.title: what a wonderfull resort
Quick objective review
reviews.text: Here are the plus points about Ocean Blue. By the way, Ocean Blue and Ocean Sand are the same resort, your bracelet says so. Villas 1 - 6 are Blue, 7 - 10 are Sand.

reviews.title: Stay away!
reviews.text: The food is the best we've ever had in the Dominican Republic - seriously. This is the first time I didn't pick up some sort of parasite. And, should you be lucky enough to be there on the last Saturday of the month...good for you. Go to the buffet that night where they shut down the main food service area and invite you into their kitchens. Ice sculptures, lobster tails, roast beef, presciutto, steamed fish, open bar, etc. - all on buffet served from the kitchen. I was a chef for 8 years in NY and I must say again...Ocean Blue has the state of the art equipment from the U.S. and VERY GOOD refridgeration.

The Bars. Guess what? They serve top shelf. Yes, it's a limited variety, but so long as it's not just Dominican brand alcohol, great. There are only 2 or 3 other resorts in the D.R. that do this. I drank Stoli vodka every night. They also have Dewers, Johnny Walker Red, B&B, Candian Club, Jack Daniels, Jose Cuervo tequila, Tanqeray. When it comes to beer, we love Presidente, the Domincan stuff. It's a pilselner, so it's lighter than a lager. Good for daytime drinking. Their rum, Brugal, is excelent. Ask for "anejo" when you get rum and coke or rum and 7-up. Anejo is their aged dark rum...sweet and delicious.

reviews.text: Check in went very smooth. We’ve been to many all inclusive resorts so I pretty much know the routine, but didn’t think much about the lack of information until later for someone that has never been. They took our luggage off the bus and left it up front with the bellboy. I was shocked at the number of bags sitting there yet to be delivered to the rooms. In the past we were given a card to hand the bellboy so he would know what bags went to what rooms. The front desk didn’t say a thing to us. We just went back and pointed out our bags and had the guys write our room number on the luggage tags already attached from the flight. They also didn’t bother to tell us where the room was located, but again we just figured it out on our own. Not to worry I’m on vacation and had 7 days to find it. Luckily it only took about 10 mins. Our bags found their way to our room by the time we took our own little tour around the resort and had a bite to eat.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here fom May 17 to the 23. This resort is so beautiful. It is a tropical paradise. It is very clean. We stayed in villa 3 which is alittle walk to the beach but close to the pools and dining areas. You can do as little or as much as you want. The activities are listed in a daily paper the hotel puts out. A few tips I like to pass on are go try a spa treatment it is a great place. The treatments can be put on the credit card but not the tip. The gift shop also only takes cash. My husband played golf at the hotel but only 9 holes are finished. There are nicer courses close by they have a list at the guest relations center. We heard from other guests that the safari adventure was wonderful. Everyone has to go to Mikes coffee house very frequently it is great. We ate in the different restaurants instead of the buffet for dinner. Our favorite was the Italian with the Dominican a close second. We also left a couple of dollars each day for the housekeeper. She seemed to really appriciate it. We asked her on the first day for extra towels and water after that they were there each day. Speaking spanish is really a plus but we did not and did not have a problem . If someone does not understands you at all they will go find someone who can speak to you. The only negative thing I have to say is the time share people can be annoying. We just told them on the first day we did not want to speak to them and they left us alone. All I can say is GO GO GO you will have a great time

reviews.title: Nice resort, bad service
reviews.text: I just returned from this resort. The resort itself was very nice. The grounds were well kept and very clean. The rooms were large and clean (although the lighting was not very good). The beach was beautiful and clean. The buffet food was ok, but you really can't expect too much from a buffet, although there was a decent variety of food. The coffee bar was great. The service on the other hand was not so great. I understand that you are in the Dominican and things are more laid back, but sometimes it was ridiculous. We had problems with our air-conditioning and called for someone to fix it and we were told that they would send someone to our room. No-one ever came. This happened 5 times. They also wanted to fumigate our room while we were there and we said we didn't want it done, we got a bit of an attitude about it. Also, the service in the buffet was slow at best. I think maybe it was lack of organization, but there seemed to be rhyme or reason as to who had what responsiblities, so some people just ended up being neglected. Like I said, the resort was not all bad, but I would recommend an Iberostar resort, where the service is great.

reviews.title: Clean and well kept with a few issues
reviews.text: We are from the Los Angeles area and this was our first trip to the Dominican Republic. We found the Ocean Blue resort to be very clean. The grounds are well kept and the ocean front was beautiful with warm waters and mostly uncrowded. The primary issue that we had was not actually with the resort but with the ScubaCaribe boats that were close to the resort. Some of them apparently were not in good working order and spewed engine oil into the surf in front of the resort leaving a lot of black oil scum in the water. Hopefully they have corrected the problem as we also notified ScubaCaribe of the issue. Other things to think about were the food quality, Although plentiful and in a large variety, the meats were very tough and most of the dishes were not that flavorful. The resort also has several other restaurants on the property and we found that the wait for service was very lengthy. We had to wait for about 30 minutes for a waiter at the "Mi Casa" restaurant and at least another 30 to 40 minutes for our meal once we had ordered. We signed up for a tour to Santo Domingo which was a four hour bus ride each way and there was not much to see. The tour driver took us to a few places and for any shopping we wanted, he seemed to take us to shops where he knew the proprietors very well. These turned out to be very expensive places to shop and most items could be found elsewhere for much less money.

reviews.title: Wonderful time, learned a lot
reviews.text: Overall the resort was clean and nicely kept, the food was average. The all inclusive type of vacation was convenient for the meals and drinks. There are also free shuttles to the local shopping center, however they will try and get you to take a taxi for $18.00.

reviews.text: I would like to tell you the good things about the resort. It is BEAUTIFUL!! The beach, pool, resort area is kept so clean and manicured I felt like I was in a postcard picture. The lobby and bar area were very nice and generous with the drinks. The service at the swim up pool was the same. There were no mosquitos or bugs anywhere. The spa is wonderful, very gorgeous and professional.

The overall service was horrible and I was wearing a "blue" wrist band. We were supposed to have a fully stocked mini-bar in our room...we did...but you can't drink the beer when no one will give you a bottle opener. It took 4 days to get a bottle opener brought to our room.

reviews.text: The language barrier is HUGE. For example, one night we ordered room service. We asked for 2 hamburgers and a pizza. We got one hamburger and a ham and cheese sandwich. If you don't speak spanish you can forget it. The food was bland, weird and unappetizing. The same thing was served at both buffets day after day. The restaurants were average at best.

reviews.text: Food selection was good, and the beach was beautiful. While I prefer a more intimate atmosphere, I found the resort quite nice, it was spacious and had a fair amount of options for a la carte restaurants. Sadly, the Dominican feel was absent from the resort, lobby bar entertainment seemed to cater to the North American clientele, mostly English music being played.
